Class RMIClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.client.Client
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.client.rmi.RMIClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientInterface, RMIVirtualClient, VirtualClient, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class RMIClient extends Client implements RMIVirtualClient
Represents the RMI client.

This class is responsible for establishing a connection with an RMI server, sending user inputs to the server, and receiving game updates and errors from the server. It implements RMIVirtualClient to be remotely accessible by the server, Runnable to handle its own connection logic in a separate thread, and ClientInterface to provide a common interface for client operations.

Version:
1.5
Author:
giacomoamaducci

      public RMIClient(View view) throws RemoteException

      Parameters:
      view - The user interface implementation for this client.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an RMI communication error occurs during object export.

    • setHandler

      public void setHandler(RMIVirtualServer handler) throws RemoteException
      Sets the server's handler for this client. This method is called by the RMI server after a successful connection to provide the client with a remote reference to the server. It also sends an initial handshake message to the server.
      Specified by:
      setHandler in interface RMIVirtualClient
      Parameters:
      handler - The RMIVirtualServer interface, which acts as a remote reference to the server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an RMI communication error occurs.

    • reportErrorToClient

      public void reportErrorToClient(GameError error) throws RemoteException
      Reports an error message received from the server to the client.
      Specified by:
      reportErrorToClient in interface RMIVirtualClient
      Parameters:
      error - The GameError object containing details about the error.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an RMI communication error occurs (though typically handled by the RMI runtime).

    • receiveUserInput

      public void receiveUserInput(UserInput input)
      Passes a UserInput object to the client to be interpreted and converted into relevant game actions.

      This implementation forwards the UserInput object to the server, delegating the sending process to an ExecutorService to avoid blocking the client thread.

      Specified by:
      receiveUserInput in interface ClientInterface
      Specified by:
      receiveUserInput in class Client
      Parameters:
      input - the UserInput object to be interpreted.
